properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy snow possible later tonight into early Wednesday. Snow ahead of a deepening low pressure area from the Southern Plains States will spread across Northwestern Ontario tonight. Snow may become heavy at times for a few hours overnight with many areas receiving 10 to possibly 15 centimetres by Wednesday morning. The snow will quickly end Wednesday morning as the low pressure area races across Northeastern Ontario into Quebec. Hazardous winter driving conditions are expected tonight. Untreated roads may become snow covered and slippery. Low visibility in heavy snow may also be an issue to deal with. Snowfall warnings may be required as this event draws closer. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-11T02:48:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-10T10:49:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1260771770.2020
Area: City of Thunder Bay, Beardmore - Jellicoe - Macdiarmid, Gull Bay - Black Sturgeon Lake, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Upsala - Raith, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Cloud Bay - Dorion, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake, Nipigon - Rossport
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall possible tonight as a frontal system approaches with modified arctic air in place for the south coast. A frontal system will cross the south coast tonight. The front combined with the modified arctic air in place will give the potential to produce accumulating snow for neighbourhoods and roadways above 200 metres, including the Malahat Summit and Port Alberni Summit on Hwy 4. Wet snow is possible down to sea level on the mainland side where a cool easterly wind may keep surface temperatures just above the freezing mark. Snowfall amounts of up to 5 cm are possible mainly over higher terrain. The front will move out of the region overnight. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-10T15:28:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-09T23:29:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2860166779.2020
Area: East Vancouver Island - Duncan to Nanaimo, East Vancouver Island - Nanoose Bay to Fanny Bay, East Vancouver Island - Courtenay to Campbell River, Inland Vancouver Island, Sunshine Coast - Gibsons to Earls Cove, Sunshine Coast - Saltery Bay to Powell River, Howe Sound, Metro Vancouver - central including the City of Vancouver Burnaby and New Westminster, Metro Vancouver - southeast including Surrey and Langley, Fraser Valley - west including Abbotsford, Fraser Valley - central including Chilliwack, Fraser Valley - east including Hope
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain possible later tonight into early Wednesday. Rain or some wet snow ahead of a deepening low pressure area from the Southern Plains States will spread across Northern Ontario tonight. As colder air from the north filters in and causes temperatures to drop to near or a little below the zero degree mark, freezing rain may develop and persist for a few hours overnight. The freezing rain will end Wednesday morning as the low races across Northeastern Ontario into Quebec. Driving conditions may deteriorate tonight. Untreated roads may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings may be required as this event draws closer. . ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-11T02:49:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-10T10:50:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0658447408.2020
Area: Manitouwadge - Hornepayne, Marathon - Schreiber, White River - Dubreuilville, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall possible tonight as a frontal system approaches with modified arctic air in place for the south coast. A frontal system will cross the south coast tonight. The front combined with the modified arctic air in place will give the potential to produce accumulating snow for neighbourhoods and roadways above 200 metres, including the Malahat Summit and Port Alberni Summit on Hwy 4. Wet snow is possible down to sea level on the mainland side where a cool easterly wind may keep surface temperatures just above the freezing mark. Snowfall amounts of up to 5 cm are possible mainly over higher terrain. The front will move out of the region overnight. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Sasktel Service Outage In Kinoosao And Uranium City
properties.Summary:
Description: There is a service outage in Kinoosao and Uranium City affecting all SaskTel services in those communities. SaskTel crews are working to restore service as quickly as possible, however there currently is no estimated time of repair.

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By Resort Village Of Thode
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Resort Village of Thode. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the the Resort Village of Thode water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-11-13T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK RV of Shields and Thode, 2020-11-09T09:18:50-06:00, D417E605-AD8C-4C81-8CA7-7F965190FDFC
Area: Resort Village of Thode
properties.Author: SK RV of Shields and Thode

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentration of pollutants are expected and will result in poor air quality, especially in urban areas where pollutant emissions are higher. High concentrations of pollutants are expected to persist until late this morning. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. In Quebec, wood heating is the main source of fine particles that contribute to smog during winter. This activity generates the largest number of these particulates, more than industrial activities and transportation. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-11-10T20:59:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal, 2020-11-10T14:32:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0126171130.2020
Area: Portneuf area, Valcartier - Stoneham area, Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area, Saint-Lambert area, Lotbinière area, Lac-Etchemin area, Sainte-Marie-de-Beauce area, Saint-Georges-de-Beauce area, Montmagny - Saint-Jean-Port-Joli area, Saint-Fabien - Saint-Pamphile area
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 10 cm continues. A Pacific frontal system moving across central British Columbia will bring widespread snow to the interior regions tonight. 10 cm of snow will accumulate before tapering off to a few flurries early Tuesday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-10T16:21:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-10T03:53:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3889508898.2020
Area: North Okanagan - including Vernon, Shuswap, North Thompson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Blizzard conditions have developed in Ulukhaktok and Sachs Harbour. Visibility will improve early this afternoon as winds diminish im Ulukhatok and this morning in Sachs Harbour. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-10T20:59:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-10T12:09:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1869741702.2020
Area: Sachs Harbour, Ulukhaktok
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 5 to 10 cm is expected. Wet snow tonight mainly over higher terrain. A Pacific frontal system crossing the south coast tonight will bring wet snow or rain to Metro Vancouver tonight. The precipitation will last through this evening then end overnight as the system moves to the south. Snowfall amounts will vary considerably depending on elevation. Accumulations will range from a trace to 2 cm at sea level, near 5 cm at 150 metres above sea level and up to 10 cm for the highest neighbourhoods. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-10T15:29:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-09T23:30:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3285953880.2020
Area: Metro Vancouver - North Shore including West Vancouver and North Vancouver, Metro Vancouver - northeast including Coquitlam and Maple Ridge

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: southwesterly 80 km/h, except 120 in the Canada Bay area. Time span: continuing until near midnight tonight. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
